meanings.definition: The quality or state of being wooden.
meanings.sent1: Her woodenness in the play made her seem stiff and unnatural on stage.
meanings.sent2: The woodenness of the table gave it a rustic and sturdy appearance.
meanings.sent3: The woodenness of his jokes made everyone laugh at how corny they were.
meanings.sent4: His woodenness in social situations made him feel like an outsider among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The woodenness of the old chair creaked with every movement, adding to its charm.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of resembling or being made of wood.
meanings.sent1: The woodenness of the sculpture was so realistic that it fooled many into thinking it was real wood.
meanings.sent2: The woodenness of the house gave it a warm and cozy feel.
meanings.sent3: The woodenness of the toy car made it look like a miniature version of a real vehicle.
meanings.sent4: Her woodenness in painting gave her artworks a unique texture and depth.
meanings.sent5: The woodenness of the fence blended seamlessly with the natural surroundings of the garden.
